column1: Pellagra is a disease that occurs when a person does not get enough niacin (one of the B complex vitamins) or tryptophan (an amino acid).
Your health care provider will perform a physical exam.
The goal of treatment is to increase your body's niacin level.
Symptoms due to the pellagra, such as skin sores, will be treated.
Left untreated, pellagra can result in nerve damage, especially in the brain.
Call your health care provider if you have any symptoms of pellagra.
